column4: can someone please help with a cacti issue? the cacti room is not as lively as I had hoped
I get this error when trying to poll for interface statistics:  + Executing SNMP walk for list of indexes @ '.1.3.6.1.2.1.2.2.1.1' error?
+ Running data query [1].
+ Found type = '3' [snmp query].
+ Found data query XML file at '/usr/share/cacti/site/resource/snmp_queries/interface.xml'
+ XML file parsed ok.
+ Executing SNMP walk for list of indexes @ '.1.3.6.1.2.1.2.2.1.1'
+ No SNMP data returned
so no snmp data is returned ...
How are youpolling for interface statistics?
snmp
and I can walk
snmp spine
snmp and spine rather
snmp and spine
Ive yet to use snmp, am installing it now.
wow... thanks
So what is the exact command  you used to produce the output you sent us?
hrmmm... not exactly sure... it looks like cacti is just doing an snmpwalk with values gathered rfom an xml... im just starting to learn this so I am not sure.
so pretty much, I can snmpwalk from this host to the other from terminal, and cacti can poll for data using snmp and does not error...
you you are leaning toward a bad value from where its calling the walk
hmmm
i dont know... im looking at the xml but cannot make heads or tails of it
im going to try for local host.
